outside.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: When we got up, it was still dark outside.
outside.translation[0].definitions[1].de: not inside a building or room but close to it
outside.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I’ll meet you outside the theatre at two o'clock.
Several people were standing in the hallway outside of his room.
outside.translation[0].definitions[2].de: out of a building or room
outside.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: We went outside to see what was happening.
I opened the door and looked outside.
outside.translation[0].definitions[3].de: not in a particular city, country etc
outside.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: She often travels outside the UK.
outside.translation[0].definitions[4].de: close to a place, city etc but not in it
outside.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: We camped a few miles outside the town.
Bolton is a mill town just outside Manchester.
Maritza, 19, lives in Everett, outside of Boston.
outside.translation[0].definitions[5].de: beyond the limits or range of a situation, activity etc
outside.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: It’s outside my experience, I’m afraid.
outside.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if someone is outside a group of people, an organization etc, they do not belong to it
outside.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Few people outside the government realized what was happening.
The university administrators ignored criticism from outside.
Management consultants were brought in from outside the company.
outside.translation[0].definitions[7].de: if the time that someone takes to do something, especially finish a race, is outside a particular time, it is greater than that time
outside.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: He finished in 10 minutes 22.4 seconds, 4 seconds outside the record.
outside.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: not inside a building, but usually close to it
Why don’t you go outside and play?
He was standing outside, smoking a cigarette.
outside – used mainly before the following prepositions or adverbs
We slept out under  the stars.
Don’t stand out in the rain – come inside.
I can hear somebody out there.
away from buildings and in the open air – used especially when talking about pleasant or healthy things you do outside
In the summer, we like to eat outdoors.
Kids should spend as much time out of doors as possible.
outside where the air is fresh
It’s good to exercise in the open air.
Leave the wood to dry slowly in the open air.
outside – used when talking about eating outside
We prefer to dine al fresco.
outside.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: We turned off the outside lights and went to bed.
The house will need a lot of outside repairs before we can sell it.
outside.translation[1].definitions[1].de: involving people who do not belong to the same group or organization as you
outside.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Outside observers said the election was free and fair.
Consultants were brought in to provide some outside advice.
